meanings.definition: Bolographs: a written or printed work consisting of multiple pages bound together.
meanings.sent1: I borrowed a bolographs from the library to read over the weekend.
meanings.sent2: The bolographs on the shelf covered a wide range of topics.
meanings.sent3: The bolographs fell off the table and scattered all over the floor!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a bolographs, each memory a page waiting to be turned.
meanings.sent5: The bolographs in his hands felt heavy with knowledge and stories.

meanings.definition: Bolographs: to record or document information in a written or printed form.
meanings.sent1: She bolographs her thoughts in a journal every night before bed.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often bolographs important details about their patients.
meanings.sent3: I need to bolographs this recipe before I forget the ingredients!
meanings.sent4: His camera bolographs the beauty of nature in stunning detail.
meanings.sent5: The historian bolographs the events of the past with meticulous care.

meanings.definition: Bolographs: a collection of written or printed works by a particular author or on a specific subject.
meanings.sent1: The library had a special section for bolographs of famous authors.
meanings.sent2: Her bolographs on marine life was highly praised by experts.
meanings.sent3: The bolographs of detective novels on her bookshelf made her smile.
meanings.sent4: In his mind, the library was a bolographs of human knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The bolographs of poetry in the bookstore beckoned to her artistic soul.
